snippet: Growth in the number of nonprofit organizations has vastly outpaced that for-profit businesses, according to data from the Urban Institute.
abstract: Anna Bernasek Datapoints column cites study from the Urban Institute finding that number of nonprofits in the United States surged by 25 percent from 2001 to 2011, far outpacing the growth of for-profit businesses; notes that health care needs related to an aging population, along with the effects of the Great Recession, are two contributing factors.
lead_paragraph: Growth in the number of nonprofit organizations has vastly outpaced that for-profit businesses, according to data from the Urban Institute.

headline.main: For Nonprofits, a Bigger Share of the Economy
headline.print_headline: For Nonprofits, a Bigger Share of the Action
